Description: An employee of the military prosecutor's office was arrested for organizing the escape of soldiers from the warAccording to -Kommersant-, a military employee The prosecutor's office, who acted as the state prosecutor in cases of military personnel, was arrested for helping deserters escape. So far, one episode appears in the case of the hereditary employee of the supervisory department, however, according to the FSB military counterintelligence, he could have helped dozens of people leave the combat zone. The investigation is being supervised by the Main Military Prosecutor's Office.Lieutenant Colonel of Justice Alexey Akhrameshin was detained in a unit of the Central Military District, from where he was assigned to the prosecutor's office of the Joint Group of Forces. In Moscow, he was charged under Article 290 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (taking a bribe), and the 235th Garrison Military Court chose a preventive measure in the form of two months of arrest.The investigation claims that Akhrameshin received 200 thousand rubles for the removal of a native of Sochi who decided to desert. The fugitive was included in the travel application under the pretext of participating in the trial as a witness. When checking the car, the prosecutor gave the password, avoiding inspection. After that, he delivered the deserter to Rostov-on-Don, where his relatives picked him up.

Description: 49 people became infected with hepatitis B and C in the Kamchatka cancer clinic due to the negligence of medical workersAccording to the Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky court, from November 2023 to December 2024, 49 cases of infection: 36 of them an acute form of the disease was diagnosed, and a chronic form of the disease. It is alleged that all those infected underwent a computed tomography (CT) scan with contrast. The information was confirmed by the head of the regional Ministry of Health, Alexander Gashkov (on video).After the outbreak, experts from Moscow were brought in to conduct an epidemiological investigation. They found that the infection spread due to violations of sanitary standards - lack of antiseptics, improper handling of equipment and the use of multi-dose bottles of saline solution. In addition, the virus can be transmitted to patients due to the fact that staff did not clean their hands and used disposable instruments several times.There may be more people infected, since about 1,000 people had MRIs with contrast in the office. Now the work of the CT room has been suspended for a month. The Investigative Committee in Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky opened a criminal case on the fact of criminal negligence of unidentified employees of the Kamchatka Regional Oncology Dispensary, which negligently resulted in the infliction of grievous harm to human health (Part 2 of Article 293 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation). Then, finally, I was able to reach her by phone. that she left in Lebyazhka and got lost in the forest and that‚Äôs it, the connection was lost! More than two hours!-writes the victim‚Äôs daughter.
